For once, the numbers are not on people like you's side. Yorick is the only "reworked" champion who did not see a major increase in playrate. In fact, I see him even less nowadays. If he was as fun as you say, people would actually care about him, but they don't. Look at the comments. Look at how everyone still sees him.

Also, for you to try and compare Rengar to Yorick is absolutely ridiculous, and only proves to me that the only part of a champion you can and will ever enjoy is their kit. Their playstyle, voice, lore, and visuals mean absolutely nothing to you. I suppose it's only natural that you wouldn't be able to understand Old Yorick. Perhaps my expectations were just too high, after being away from the boards for so long. Thank you for bringing me back into reality.

Yorick did not fit the game and had to be modernized, since he wasn't played by anyone they decided to change his kit and identity in the process to try to help him, because that is what they need to do as a business. 
Do you really think that they should just leave a champion in a poor state and allow it to stagnate and place a drain on the game and the company's potential earnings just so an insignificant number of players can continue playing that champion instead of bringing it up to par with the rest of the roster and making it more appealing to a larger percentage of players?

Old Yorick was really only good in One-For-All because he could become an unkillable monster thanks to his passive giving 10% damage reduction and AA damage for each ghoul including his allies' ghouls, and each of his 3 basic abilities created a ghoul. 
Outside of that he was only good as a surprise jungler or occasionally top laner that nobody knew how to deal with because nobody played him and he was really weird because he was one of the old melee mages that have basically all been reworked into standard tanks like Galio and Mao.
His playstyle was run up and press all of your buttons, so it really wasn't engaging or anything, but it was different from other tanks because he was more like a melee burst mage.

That really does not sound like it would be that fun to play against and it would get boring to play is if you got bullied enough in the jungle or in lane. Still thank you for explaining how old Yorick worked in a quick and dirty way.

Unlike our digital companions remember Momento Mori, unlike Good Sir Mori.

Honestly, I'm tired of seeing all these complaints in the comments. "Oh it's not original", "I want the old Yorick back", "Gold is ugly", "Arclight doesn't fit his theme". Please. I don't even play Yorick much and I know how much you guys have wanted a new, high-quality skin, and Riot creates such a masterpiece of golden colors and awesome texture changes, and all I see are complaints. Arclight skins were never released side-by-side like Star Guardian or PROJECT, it's already more original than most. Obviously this doesn't fit his theme, skins are supposed to change it up. Otherwise they would just make skins like "Swordsman Master Yi" or "Archer Ashe". Anyways, I really love how this skin turned out, it was everything I wanted it to be and more.

It's a good looking skin, but it just doesn't feel right to me on Yorick to be perfectly honest, speaking as somebody that plays him all the time. I would have preferred basically anything else, if they wanted to go more opposite of his usual tone or theme a Pool Party Yorick would have been more appealing, or even Crazy Cat Lady Yorick (which Rioters have seen on the boards and looked like they enjoyed).
